alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 20 at 9:02PM CST until November 20 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Clarke County in east central Mississippi... Southeastern Lauderdale County in east central Mississippi... * Until 1000 PM CST. * At 902 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Orange, or 12 miles west of Quitman, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Stonewall, Enterprise, and Pachuta around 905 PM CST. Savoy and Sable around 915 PM CST. Middleton around 920 PM CST. Zero around 925 PM CST. Causeyville around 930 PM CST. Snell around 935 PM CST. Alamucha around 945 PM CST. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for east central Mississippi.
